article.title: Critical Slowing Down of Quadrupole and Hexadecapole Orderings in Iron Pnictide Superconductor

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 1(a) shows the temperature dependence of the ultrasonic attenuation coefficient (α66) and the elastic constant (C66) for Ba(Fe1-xCox)2As2 with x = 0.071. What is the primary cause of the marked increase in α66 around the superconducting transition temperature (TSC = 23 K)?
choices: Critical slowing down of the quadrupole Ox2−y2 interacting with strain εxy.
Critical slowing down of the order parameter around the superconducting transition.
The softening of C66 due to spin nematic fluctuations.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 1(b) depicts the temperature dependence of the relaxation time (τ) derived from the attenuation coefficient data in Figure 1(a). What critical index (zν) best describes the relaxation time behavior in the normal phase above TSC?

Figure 2 presents the temperature dependence of elastic constants for Ba(Fe1-xCox)2As2 with x = 0.036. Which elastic constant exhibits the most significant softening, reaching 85% reduction before the structural transition?
Figure 2(e) shows the softening of C66 and marks the temperatures of different transitions. What transition is associated with the anomaly marked by the arrow at 39 K?

Figure 3(a) displays the temperature dependence of the ultrasonic attenuation coefficient (αL[110]) and the elastic constant (CL[110]) for Ba(Fe1-xCox)2As2 with x = 0.036. What is the primary cause of the increased αL[110] with approaching the structural transition point (Ts = 65 K)?
choices: Critical slowing down of the order parameter accompanying the superconducting transition.
Critical slowing down of the quadrupole Ox2−y2, the order parameter of the structural transition.
The increase in dispersive scattering of the ultrasonic wave by domain walls.
The superconducting transition at TSC = 16.4 K.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 3(b) shows the relaxation time (τ) derived from αL[110] data. What is the relationship between the attempt times (τ0) for the tetragonal and orthorhombic phases according to the fit based on Eq. (4)?
Figure 4 displays the critical temperatures related to structural (ST) and superconducting (SC) transitions in Ba(Fe1-xCox)2As2. What does the red solid line represent?
According to Figure 4, what happens to the critical temperature T0s (blue filled circles) as the Co concentration (x) increases beyond the quantum critical point (xQCP = 0.061)?
choices: It becomes positive, indicating a real structural transition.
It becomes negative, indicating a fictitious lattice instability point.
It remains positive but decreases significantly.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 8 shows the divergence of the relaxation time (τH) and the softening of the elastic constant (C66) for Ba(Fe1-xCox)2As2 with x = 0.071. What order parameter is responsible for the divergence of τH around the superconducting transition temperature (TSC = 23 K)?
What does the temperature T0s = -26.5 K, marked by red open circles and the intersection of blue dashed line with temperature axis, represent in Figure 8?
choices: Fictitious lattice instability point for C66 → 0
